tasks.task: Setup and manage flood irrigation system in a Wyoming farm.
subtasks: Dig a ditch at the top of the field.
Construct a canvas dam in the field for water control.
Position the canvas dam to desired irrigation area.
Utilize aluminum pipes to siphon water from the ditch.
Employ gated aluminum or plastic pipes for precise water distribution.
Open and close gates on pipes to allocate water to various field sections.

tasks.task: Develop surface irrigation using traditional methods.
subtasks: Understand the historical significance of surface irrigation techniques.
Recognize the widespread use of flood irrigation in Wyoming's farming regions.
Acknowledge the efficiency and cost-effectiveness of surface irrigation methods.
Compare flood irrigation acreage with sprinkler irrigation across national levels.

tasks.task: Develop surface irrigation using traditional methods (Old-fashioned techniques).
subtasks: Understand the historical significance of surface irrigation techniques.

subtasks: Dig a ditch at the top of the field.

tasks.task: Understand and use traditional surface irrigation methods.
subtasks: Recognize surface irrigation as one of the oldest agricultural techniques.
Know the current usage of surface irrigation in Wyoming's farming regions.
Acknowledge the efficiency and cost-effectiveness of surface irrigation.
Compare surface irrigation practices with other methods nationally.
